greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least positive multiple of 2n-1 which is palindromic in base 2.
comment: Even numbers cannot be palindromic in base 2 (unless leading zeros are considered), that's why we search for odd numbers 2n-1 their smallest multiple k(2n-1) which is palindromic in base 2. Obviously this must always be odd.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: pal2[n_]:=Module[{k=1},While[IntegerDigits[k n,2] != Reverse[ IntegerDigits[ k n,2]],k++];k n]; pal2/@Range[1,121,2] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 29 2012 *)
program: a141708 n = a141707 n * (2 * n - 1) -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 20 2015
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 17 2008
